parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description:
Project endpoint. In the form "https://your-ai-services-account-name.services.ai.azure.com/api/projects/_project"
if your Foundry Hub has only one Project, or to use the default Project in your Hub. Or in the form 
"https://your-ai-services-account-name.services.ai.azure.com/api/projects/your-project-name" if you want to explicitly
specify the Foundry Project name.

get.description: Retrieves detailed row-by-row evaluation results with pagination support. This endpoint provides access to individual evaluation outcomes, scores, and reasoning for each data row processed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the evaluation whose results are being retrieved

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: API version specifier for this operation

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Maximum number of result items to return in a single response. Must be a multiple of 10 (e.g., 10, 20, 100, 1000). Defaults to 10 if not specified.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of result items to skip before returning results, enabling pagination through large result sets. Must be a multiple of 10. Defaults to 0.

post.description: Creates a new evaluation with the specified configuration.

parameters.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
parameters.description: Unique, client-generated identifier for ensuring request idempotency. Use the same ID for retries to prevent duplicate evaluations.

parameters.name: Repeatability-First-Sent
parameters.description: Timestamp indicating when this request was first initiated. Used in conjunction with repeatability-request-id for idempotency control.

parameters.description: Complete evaluation configuration including data source, evaluators, and result settings

AIContent.description: Content for AI requests and responses.

AgentEvaluation.description: Evaluation response for agent evaluation run.

id.description: Identifier of the agent evaluation run.

status.description: Status of the agent evaluation. Options: Running, Completed, Failed.

error.description: The reason of the request failure for the long running process, if applicable.

AgentEvaluationRedactionConfiguration.description: The redaction configuration will allow the user to control what is redacted.

redactScoreProperties.description: Redact score properties. If not specified, the default is to redact in production.

threadId.description: Identifier of the agent thread. This field is mandatory currently, but it will be optional in the future.

evaluators.description: Evaluators to be used for the evaluation.

appInsightsConnectionString.description: Pass the AppInsights connection string to the agent evaluation for the evaluation results and the errors logs.

AgentEvaluationResult.description: Result for the agent evaluation evaluator run.

evaluator.description: Evaluator's name. This is the name of the evaluator that was used to evaluate the agent's completion.

score.description: Score of the given evaluator. No restriction on range.

status.description: Status of the evaluator result. Options: Running, Completed, Failed, NotApplicable.

version.description: Version of the evaluator that was used to evaluate the agent's completion.

threadId.description: The unique identifier of the thread.

runId.description: The unique identifier of the run.

error.description: A string explaining why there was an error, if applicable.

additionalDetails.description: Additional properties relevant to the evaluator. These will differ between evaluators.

maxRequestRate.description: Maximum request rate per hour (0 to 1000).

AgentToolDefinition.description: Definition of a tool that can be used by the agent.

parameters.description: The parameters for the tool in JSON Schema format.

AggregatedMetric.description: Aggregated metric that summarizes evaluation results across multiple data rows.

evaluatorName.description: Name provided for the evaluator in the input request.

statistics.description: Statistical summary of evaluation results including aggregated scores and pass/fail rates.

additionalDetails.description: Additional metadata about the aggregated metric, such as processing details or custom fields

AppInsightsDestinationConfiguration.description: Configuration for exporting evaluation results to Azure Application Insights. This enables monitoring, alerting, and analytics on evaluation performance and trends.

AssetCredentialResponse.description: Represents a reference to a blob for consumption

blobReference.description: Credential info to access the storage account.

AssistantMessage.description: A message generated by the assistant in response to previous messages.

content.description: Response content generated by the assistant.

values.name: Easy
values.description: Represents a default set of easy complexity attacks. Easy complexity attacks require less effort, such as translation of a prompt into some encoding, and does not require any Large Language Model to convert or orchestrate.

values.name: Moderate
values.description: Represents a default set of moderate complexity attacks. Moderate complexity attacks require having access to resources such as another generative AI model.

values.name: Difficult
values.description: Represents a default set of difficult complexity attacks. Difficult complexity attacks include attacks that require access to significant resources and effort to execute an attack such as knowledge of search-based algorithms in addition to a generative AI model.

values.name: AsciiArt
values.description: Generates visual art using ASCII characters, often used for creative or obfuscation purposes.

values.name: AsciiSmuggler
values.description: Conceals data within ASCII characters, making it harder to detect.

values.name: Atbash
values.description: Implements the Atbash cipher, a simple substitution cipher where each letter is mapped to its reverse.

values.name: Base64
values.description: Encodes binary data into a text format using Base64, commonly used for data transmission.

values.name: Binary
values.description: Converts text into binary code, representing data in a series of 0s and 1s.

values.name: Caesar
values.description: Applies the Caesar cipher, a substitution cipher that shifts characters by a fixed number of positions.

values.name: CharacterSpace
values.description: Alters text by adding spaces between characters, often used for obfuscation.

values.name: Jailbreak
values.description: Injects specially crafted prompts to bypass AI safeguards, known as User Injected Prompt Attacks (UPIA).

values.name: AnsiiAttack
values.description: Utilizes ANSI escape sequences to manipulate text appearance and behavior.

values.name: CharacterSwap
values.description: Swaps characters within text to create variations or obfuscate the original content.

values.name: SuffixAppend
values.description: Appends an adversarial suffix to the prompt.

values.name: StringJoin
values.description: Joins multiple strings together, often used for concatenation or obfuscation.

values.name: UnicodeConfusable
values.description: Uses Unicode characters that look similar to standard characters, creating visual confusion.

values.name: UnicodeSubstitution
values.description: Substitutes standard characters with Unicode equivalents, often for obfuscation.

values.name: Diacritic
values.description: Adds diacritical marks to characters, changing their appearance and sometimes their meaning.

values.name: Flip
values.description: Flips characters from front to back, creating a mirrored effect.

values.name: Leetspeak
values.description: Transforms text into Leetspeak, a form of encoding that replaces letters with similar-looking numbers or symbols.

values.name: ROT13
values.description: Applies the ROT13 cipher, a simple substitution cipher that shifts characters by 13 positions.

values.name: Morse
values.description: Encodes text into Morse code, using dots and dashes to represent characters.

values.name: Url
values.description: Encodes text into URL format.

values.name: Baseline
values.description: Represents the baseline direct adversarial probing, which is used by attack strategies as the attack objective.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Azure REST API guidelines - https://aka.ms/AzureRestApiGuidelines#handling-errors.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

values.name: NotStarted
values.description: The operation has not started.

values.name: Running
values.description: The operation is in progress.

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: The operation has completed successfully.

values.name: Failed
values.description: The operation has failed.

values.name: Canceled
values.description: The operation has been canceled by the user.

connectionName.description: Name of connection to Azure AI Search

indexName.description: Name of index in Azure AI Search resource to attach

AzureOpenAIModelConfiguration.description: Azure OpenAI model configuration. The API version would be selected by the service for querying the model.

modelDeploymentName.description: Deployment name for AOAI model. Example: gpt-4o if in AIServices or connection based `connection_name/deployment_name` (e.g. `my-aoai-connection/gpt-4o`).

modelParameters.description: Optional model-specific parameters to fine-tune behavior during evaluation. These may include temperature, max tokens, top-p, frequency penalty, and other model configuration options supported by the deployment.

AzureOpenAIModelConfigurationUpdate.description: Azure OpenAI model configuration. The API version would be selected by the service for querying the model.

modelDeploymentName.description: Deployment name for AOAI model. Example: gpt-4o if in AIServices or connection based `connection_name/deployment_name` (e.g. `my-aoai-connection/gpt-4o`).

modelParameters.description: Optional model-specific parameters to fine-tune behavior during evaluation. These may include temperature, max tokens, top-p, frequency penalty, and other model configuration options supported by the deployment.

BaseCredentials.description: A base class for connection credentials

type.description: The type of credential used by the connection

blobUri.description: Blob URI path for client to upload data. Example: https://blob.windows.core.net/Container/Path

storageAccountArmId.description: ARM ID of the storage account to use.

credential.description: Credential info to access the storage account.

lowerBound.description: Lower bound of the confidence interval for the average score, providing a range within which the true average is likely to fall.

upperBound.description: Upper bound of the confidence interval for the average score, providing a range within which the true average is likely to fall.

Connection.description: Response from the list and get connections operations

name.description: The friendly name of the connection, provided by the user.

id.description: A unique identifier for the connection, generated by the service

target.description: The connection URL to be used for this service

isDefault.description: Whether the connection is tagged as the default connection of its type

credentials.description: The credentials used by the connection

ConnectionType.description: The Type (or category) of the connection

values.name: AzureOpenAI
values.description: Azure OpenAI Service

values.description: Azure Blob Storage, with specified container

values.name: AzureStorageAccount
values.description: Azure Blob Storage, with container not specified (used by Agents)

values.description: Azure AI Search

values.description: CosmosDB

CredentialType.description: The credential type used by the connection

values.name: apiKey
values.description: API Key credential

values.name: entraId
values.description: Entra ID credential (formerly known as AAD)

values.name: SAS

values.name: custom

DatasetId.description: Unique identifier of a dataset registered in AI Foundry workspace. The identifier follows the format: azureai://accounts/{resourceName}/projects/{projectName}/data/{datasetName}/versions/{versionNumber}

DatasetType.description: Enum to determine the type of data.

values.name: uri_file
values.description: URI file.

values.name: uri_folder
values.description: URI folder.

isReference.description: Indicates if the dataset holds a reference to the storage, or the dataset manages storage itself. If true, the underlying data will not be deleted when the dataset version is deleted

connectionName.description: The Azure Storage Account connection name. Required if startPendingUploadVersion was not called before creating the Dataset

id.description: Asset ID, a unique identifier for the asset

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

values.name: ModelDeployment
values.description: Model deployment

DeveloperMessage.description: A message authored by a developer to guide the model during evaluation.

content.description: Content provided by a developer to guide model behavior in an evaluation context.

modelDeploymentName.description: Deployment name of embedding model. It can point to a model deployment either in the parent AIServices or a connection.

dataSource.description: Data source configuration that specifies where the evaluation data comes from. This replaces the legacy 'data' field and provides more flexible data source options.

resultSettings.description: Configuration settings that control how evaluation results are processed, stored, and exported

displayName.description: Display Name for evaluation. It helps to find the evaluation easily in AI Foundry. It does not need to be unique.

description.description: Description of the evaluation. It can be used to store additional information about the evaluation and is mutable.

state.description: Current operational state of the evaluation. This field is managed by the service and reflects the evaluation's progress from initiation to completion.

tags.description: Evaluation's tags. Unlike properties, tags are fully mutable.

properties.description: Evaluation's properties. Unlike tags, properties are add-only. Once added, a property cannot be removed.

evaluators.description: Evaluators to be used for the evaluation.

summary.description: Aggregated summary of evaluation results for each configured evaluator. This provides a high-level overview of performance across all data rows.

resultDatasetId.description:
Unique identifier of the dataset containing detailed evaluation results. This dataset is created automatically upon evaluation completion and contains row-by-row results for analysis.
 The identifier follows the format: azureai://accounts/{resourceName}/projects/{projectName}/datasets/{datasetName}/versions/{versionNumber}.
 Note: This dataset is only available when the result retention policy permits detailed result storage.

systemData.description: System-generated metadata containing internal service information for debugging and operational purposes. This field is managed by the service and cannot be modified by clients.

EvaluationDataSource.description: Base class for different types of evaluation data sources. Use the discriminator field 'type' to specify the specific data source implementation.

type.description: Specifies the type of data source being used for evaluation

EvaluationDataSourceType.description: Specifies the type of data source used for evaluation. Different types support various data input methods and formats.

values.name: InlineData
values.description: Use inline JSON data provided directly in the request

values.name: Dataset
values.description: Use a dataset that has been registered and stored in AI Foundry workspace

values.name: FoundryModelInline
values.description: Use data generated by running a model deployment against inline queries provided in the request

values.name: FoundryModelDataset
values.description: Use data generated by running a model deployment against a registered dataset

EvaluationDataSourceUpdate.description: Base class for different types of evaluation data sources. Use the discriminator field 'type' to specify the specific data source implementation.

type.description: Specifies the type of data source being used for evaluation

EvaluationDestinationConfiguration.description: Base configuration for exporting evaluation results to external storage destinations. This enables integration with external analytics and monitoring systems.

type.description: Specifies the type of external storage destination

connectionName.description: Name of the connection resource configured in the AI Foundry workspace. This connection must be properly configured with appropriate credentials before use.

state.description: Current state of the export operation to this destination. This field is managed by the service and cannot be modified by clients.

EvaluationDestinationConfigurationType.description: Specifies the type of external storage destination where evaluation results can be exported for further analysis or long-term retention.

values.name: AppInsightsStorage
values.description: Export evaluation results to Azure Application Insights for monitoring and analytics

values.name: StorageAccountStorage
values.description: Export evaluation results to Azure Blob Storage for data archival and custom processing

EvaluationMetric.description: Metric representing the evaluation result for a specific evaluator.

evaluatorName.description: Name provided for the evaluator in the input request.

score.description: Score assigned by the evaluator to the specific data row

labels.description: Optional labels associated with the evaluation result.

reasoning.description: Reasoning or explanation provided by the evaluator for the score assigned to this data row

error.description: Error message describing why the evaluation failed for this data row, if applicable

usage.description: Token consumption for this metric evaluation

additionalDetails.description: Additional metadata about the evaluation result, such as processing details or custom fields

EvaluationModelSourceCommon.description: Common properties shared across model deployment configurations used in evaluations.

modelTarget.description: Configuration for the model deployment used in evaluation.

baseMessages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far. Each message can be a json string with role and content to specify the conversation context.

EvaluationResult.description: Comprehensive evaluation results for a single data row, including the input data, processing state, and results from all configured evaluators.

id.description: Unique identifier for this evaluation result row

error.description: Error message describing why the evaluation failed for this data row, if applicable

inputDataJson.description: Original input data for this row in JSON string format. This preserves the exact data that was evaluated for reference and debugging.

metrics.description: Evaluation results from all the configured evaluators for this data row.

evaluatorId.description: Unique identifier of the evaluator that produced this result

desiredDirection.description: Desired direction for the evaluation score.

threshold.description: Threshold value that this score is compared against to determine the evaluation outcome

EvaluationResultOutcome.description: Defines the possible outcomes of an evaluation result, indicating whether the evaluated data meets the specified criteria or standards.

values.name: pass
values.description: The evaluation completed successfully and met the specified criteria or threshold

values.name: fail
values.description: The evaluation completed but did not meet the specified criteria or threshold

values.name: notEvaluated
values.description: The evaluation has not been processed yet or is still in progress

values.name: notApplicable
values.description: The evaluation criteria do not apply to this particular data row or context

values.name: skipped
values.description: The evaluation is skipped for this particular data row

values.name: error
values.description: The evaluation resulted in an error for this particular data row

EvaluationResultSettings.description: Configuration settings that control how evaluation results are processed, stored, and exported. These settings affect data privacy, retention, and integration with external systems.

additionalDestinations.description: List of external storage destinations where evaluation results should be exported in addition to the default AI Foundry storage

EvaluationSummaryResult.description: Summary of evaluation results, including aggregated metrics and evaluator statuses.

evaluatorStatus.description: Status of each evaluator from the input request.

metrics.description: Aggregated metrics that summarize evaluation results across multiple data rows. This provides a high-level overview of performance across all data rows.

EvaluationSummaryStatistics.description: Statistical summary of evaluation results including aggregated scores and pass/fail rates.

sampleCount.description: Total number of rows that were evaluated.

passRate.description: Proportion of evaluation results that passed the specified criteria or threshold, expressed as a value between 0 and 1.

min.description: Lowest score value observed across all evaluation results.

max.description: Highest score value observed across all evaluation results.

average.description: Arithmetic mean of all score values in the evaluation results.

standardDeviation.description: Standard deviation of score values, indicating the variability or spread of scores around the average.

confidenceInterval95th.description: Confidence interval for the average score, providing a range within which the pass average is likely to fall (95th percentile).

labelFrequency.description: Label frequency distribution, showing how often each label appears in the evaluation results. This can help identify common themes or issues across evaluated data rows.

dataSource.description: Data source configuration that specifies where the evaluation data comes from. This replaces the legacy 'data' field and provides more flexible data source options.

resultSettings.description: Configuration settings that control how evaluation results are processed, stored, and exported

displayName.description: Display Name for evaluation. It helps to find the evaluation easily in AI Foundry. It does not need to be unique.

description.description: Description of the evaluation. It can be used to store additional information about the evaluation and is mutable.

tags.description: Evaluation's tags. Unlike properties, tags are fully mutable.

properties.description: Evaluation's properties. Unlike tags, properties are add-only. Once added, a property cannot be removed.

evaluators.description: Evaluators to be used for the evaluation.

name.description: Name of the evaluator. It can be used for identify the evaluator in the evaluation results.

EvaluatorDesirableDirection.description: Describes the desirable direction for the evaluation score. This indicates whether a higher or lower score is preferred for this evaluator.

values.name: increase
values.description: Indicates that a higher score is desirable for this evaluator

values.name: decrease
values.description: Indicates that a lower score is desirable for this evaluator

values.name: neutral
values.description: Indicates that the score should be neutral, meaning it does not have a preferred direction

EvaluatorMessages.description: Multi-turn conversations for evaluating dialogue systems and context awareness.

query.description: Array of messages representing representing queries

toolDefinitions.description: Array of tool definitions that are used in the conversation

EvaluatorMessagesUpdate.description: Multi-turn conversations for evaluating dialogue systems and context awareness.

query.description: Array of messages representing representing queries

toolDefinitions.description: Array of tool definitions that are used in the conversation

EvaluatorStatusResult.description: Status of evaluator across all data rows.

name.description: Name of the evaluator from the input request.

id.description: Identifier of the evaluator from the input request.

state.description: State of the evaluation for this evaluator.

contentFields.description: List of fields with text content

filepathField.description: Path of file to be used as a source of text content

titleField.description: Field containing the title of the document

urlField.description: Field containing the url of the document

vectorFields.description: List of fields with vector content

metadataFields.description: List of fields with metadata content

FoundryDatasetDataSource.description: Data source that uses a dataset registered and stored in AI Foundry workspace. This is the recommended approach for large datasets or reusable evaluation data.

datasetId.description: Unique identifier of the dataset registered in AI Foundry workspace

FoundryDatasetDataSourceUpdate.description: Data source that uses a dataset registered and stored in AI Foundry workspace. This is the recommended approach for large datasets or reusable evaluation data.

datasetId.description: Unique identifier of the dataset registered in AI Foundry workspace

FoundryModelDatasetSource.description: Data source that uses a model deployment with a dataset containing prompts. The model processes each prompt from the dataset to generate responses, which are then evaluated against the configured evaluators.

modelTarget.description: Configuration for the model deployment used in evaluation.

baseMessages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far. Each message can be a json string with role and content to specify the conversation context.

datasetId.description: Unique identifier of the dataset containing prompts that will be processed by the model deployment

queryField.description: Name of the column in the dataset that contains the queries to be processed by the model deployment. This allows specifying which column should be used as input for evaluation. eg.. queryField: '${data.query}'

FoundryModelDatasetSourceUpdate.description: Data source that uses a model deployment with a dataset containing prompts. The model processes each prompt from the dataset to generate responses, which are then evaluated against the configured evaluators.

modelTarget.description: Configuration for the model deployment used in evaluation.

baseMessages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far. Each message can be a json string with role and content to specify the conversation context.

datasetId.description: Unique identifier of the dataset containing prompts that will be processed by the model deployment

queryField.description: Name of the column in the dataset that contains the queries to be processed by the model deployment. This allows specifying which column should be used as input for evaluation. eg.. queryField: '${data.query}'

FoundryModelInlineSource.description: Data source that uses a model deployment with inline queries. The specified model processes each query to generate responses, which are then evaluated against the configured evaluators.

modelTarget.description: Configuration for the model deployment used in evaluation.

baseMessages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far. Each message can be a json string with role and content to specify the conversation context.

queries.description: Inline queries to be processed by the model deployment. The response is then evaluated against the configured evaluators.

FoundryModelInlineSourceUpdate.description: Data source that uses a model deployment with inline queries. The specified model processes each query to generate responses, which are then evaluated against the configured evaluators.

modelTarget.description: Configuration for the model deployment used in evaluation.

baseMessages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far. Each message can be a json string with role and content to specify the conversation context.

queries.description: Inline queries to be processed by the model deployment. The response is then evaluated against the configured evaluators.

ImageUrlContent.description: Content for image URL messages in AI conversations.

id.description: Asset ID, a unique identifier for the asset

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

values.name: azureSearch
values.description: Azure search

values.name: cosmosDB
values.description: CosmosDB

values.name: managedAzureSearch
values.description: Managed Azure Search

InlineData.description: Base class for inline evaluation data with format discrimination.

dataFormat.description: Format of the inline data structure

InlineDataFormat.description: Available formats for structuring inline evaluation data.

values.name: queryResponseMessageFormat
values.description: Query-response pairs for Q&A and chatbot evaluations

values.name: evaluationMessagesFormat
values.description: Multi-turn conversations with role-based messages and tool definitions

values.name: inlineJsonFormat
values.description: Flexible JSON format for custom data structures

InlineDataSource.description: Data source using inline data provided directly in the request. Size limit is 2 MB

id.description: Optional unique identifier for the inline data source. This can be an agent id or a custom identifier to distinguish between different inline data sources.

data.description: Inline data structured according to the specified format

InlineDataSourceUpdate.description: Data source using inline data provided directly in the request. Size limit is 2 MB

id.description: Optional unique identifier for the inline data source. This can be an agent id or a custom identifier to distinguish between different inline data sources.

data.description: Inline data structured according to the specified format

InlineDataUpdate.description: Base class for inline evaluation data with format discrimination.

dataFormat.description: Format of the inline data structure

InlineJson.description: Custom JSON format for complex evaluation scenarios requiring flexible data structures.

messages.description: Array of JSON strings with custom fields and metadata

InlineJsonUpdate.description: Custom JSON format for complex evaluation scenarios requiring flexible data structures.

messages.description: Array of JSON strings with custom fields and metadata

ManagedAzureAISearchIndex.description: Managed Azure AI Search Index Definition

vectorStoreId.description: Vector store id of managed index

Message.description: Abstract base model representing a single message in a conversation.

role.description: The role of the message author. Known values: 'system', 'assistant', 'developer', 'user'.

MetricType.description: Enumeration of the different types of metrics that can be used in evaluations

values.name: continuous
values.description: Continuous metric type, representing a numerical score

values.name: categorical
values.description: Categorical metric type, representing discrete categories or labels

values.name: ordinal
values.description: Ordinal metric type, representing ordered categories

modelName.description: Publisher-specific name of the deployed model

modelVersion.description: Publisher-specific version of the deployed model

modelPublisher.description: Name of the deployed model's publisher

connectionName.description: Name of the connection the deployment comes from

NoAuthenticationCredentials.description: Credentials that do not require authentication

dataSource.description: Input data to evaluate. Single row support only.

evaluators.description: Evaluators to be used for the evaluation.

properties.description: Evaluation's properties. Unlike tags, properties are add-only. Once added, a property cannot be removed.

metrics.description: Evaluation results from all the configured evaluators.

value.description: The Connection items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The DatasetVersion items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The Deployment items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The Evaluation items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The EvaluationResult items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The Index items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The RedTeam items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

PendingUploadCredentialType.description: The type of credential used to access the storage account.

values.name: sas
values.description: SAS credential type.

PendingUploadRequest.description: Represents a request for a pending upload.

pendingUploadId.description: If PendingUploadId is not provided, a random GUID will be used.

connectionName.description: Azure Storage Account connection name to use for generating temporary SAS token

pendingUploadType.description: BlobReference is the only supported type.

PendingUploadResponse.description: Represents the response for a pending upload request

version.description: Version of asset to be created if user did not specify version when initially creating upload

pendingUploadType.description: BlobReference is the only supported type

values.name: none
values.description: No pending upload.

values.name: BlobReference
values.description: Blob Reference is the only supported type.

QueryResponseInlineMessages.description: Query-response pairs for evaluating Q&A systems and response accuracy.

messages.description: Array of query-response pairs with optional context and ground truth

QueryResponseInlineMessagesUpdate.description: Query-response pairs for evaluating Q&A systems and response accuracy.

messages.description: Array of query-response pairs with optional context and ground truth

QueryResponseMessage.description: Represents a message that contains a query and its corresponding response.

query.description: The query message sent to the model.

response.description: The response generated by the model in reply to the query.

context.description: Optional context information that may include additional details about the query or response, such as metadata or processing instructions.

ground_truth.description: Optional ground truth value for the query, which can be used to compare against the model's response during evaluation.

id.description: Identifier of the red team run.

attackStrategies.description: List of attack strategies or nested lists of attack strategies.

simulationOnly.description: Simulation-only or Simulation + Evaluation. Default false, if true the scan outputs conversation not evaluation result.

riskCategories.description: List of risk categories to generate attack objectives for.

applicationScenario.description: Application scenario for the red team operation, to generate scenario specific attacks.

tags.description: Red team's tags. Unlike properties, tags are fully mutable.

properties.description: Red team's properties. Unlike tags, properties are add-only. Once added, a property cannot be removed.

status.description: Status of the red-team. It is set by service and is read-only.

target.description: Target configuration for the red-team run.

RiskCategory.description: Risk category for the attack objective.

values.name: HateUnfairness
values.description: Represents content related to hate or unfairness.

values.name: Violence
values.description: Represents content related to violence.

values.name: Sexual
values.description: Represents content of a sexual nature.

values.name: SelfHarm
values.description: Represents content related to self-harm.

StorageAccountDestinationConfiguration.description: Configuration for exporting evaluation results to Azure Blob Storage. This provides long-term storage and enables custom data processing workflows.

containerName.description: Name of the container within the Azure Blob Storage account where evaluation results will be stored

SystemMessage.description: A message authored by the system to guide model behavior.

content.description: Plain text instructions provided by the system to steer model behavior.

TextContent.description: Content for text messages in AI conversations.

text.description: The text content of the message.

ToolCallContent.description: Content for text messages in AI conversations.

name.description: The name of the tool being called.

toolCallId.description: The unique identifier of the tool call.

arguments.description: The parameters for the tool call in JSON format.

ToolResultContent.description: Content for tool results in AI conversations.

results.description: The result of the tool call in JSON format.

inputTokens.description: Total number of input tokens consumed during the evaluation process

outputTokens.description: Total number of output tokens generated during the evaluation process

UserMessage.description: A message authored by the end user as input to the model.

content.description: Input content or question provided by the end user.

Azure.Core.ClientRequestIdHeader.name: x-ms-client-request-id
Azure.Core.ClientRequestIdHeader.description: An opaque, globally-unique, client-generated string identifier for the request.

Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.name: api-version
Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.description: The API version to use for this operation.
